title: Thailand celebrates 2020 – the year of the plastic bag ban
text:
Marium, a baby dugong found near Ko Libong in Thailand in May 2019. Biologists said the 8-month-old had ingested plastic waste. Credit:AP

Bangkok: Thailand began the year with a ban on single-use plastic bags at major stores, the latest move towards a complete ban in 2021.

Illustration: Cathy Wilcox Credit:

Public awareness of the risk to animals and the environment from waste and debris in the sea waste was raised last year in a series of incidents where animals, including a deer and a baby dugong, were found dead with plastics in their digestive systems.

"Thailand was ranked sixth among the world's top countries that dumps waste into the sea," Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Varawut Silpa-Archa told reporters on Wednesday after handing out reusable bags to the public.
meta_description: The government says Thailand reduced its use of plastic bags by 2 billion – or about 5765 tonnes – during 2019.
